questions.q: What does “well-drained soil” mean in practice?
choices: Excess water drains while soil remains evenly moist
Soil stays saturated for several days
Soil is mostly sand with no organic matter
questions.explain: Well-drained soil allows excess water to move through while still retaining enough moisture for roots.

questions.q: Which soil texture generally holds the most water?
questions.explain: Clay has very small particles and high surface area, allowing it to retain more water than other soil textures.

questions.q: Soil compaction primarily harms plants by reducing:
questions.explain: Compaction reduces pore space, limiting oxygen movement to roots.

questions.q: In horticultural terms, “full sun” typically means:
choices: 2–3 hours of direct sunlight per day
4–5 hours of direct sunlight per day
6 or more hours of direct sunlight per day
questions.explain: Most horticultural references define full sun as at least 6 hours of direct sunlight.

questions.q: A plant labeled “part shade” usually prefers:
questions.explain: Part shade typically means protection from intense afternoon sun, often with morning exposure.

questions.q: Overwatering most commonly damages plants by:
questions.explain: Saturated soils displace oxygen, leading to root suffocation and rot.

questions.q: Which is a reliable sign that a plant needs water?
choices: Wilting leaves in the afternoon heat
Dry soil several inches below the surface
questions.explain: Checking moisture below the surface is more reliable than visual symptoms alone.

questions.q: When planting trees, the root flare should be:
choices: Buried several inches below soil level
At or slightly above finished grade
questions.explain: Planting too deep is a common cause of failure; the root flare should be visible.

questions.q: The planting hole for a tree should generally be:
choices: As deep as the root ball and twice as wide
The same width as the root ball
questions.explain: A wide hole encourages lateral root growth while depth should not exceed the root ball height.

questions.q: The primary benefit of mulch around plants is to:
questions.explain: Mulch moderates soil temperature, reduces evaporation, and limits weed growth.

questions.q: Mulch should be kept away from direct contact with tree trunks to prevent:
questions.explain: Mulch piled against trunks traps moisture and encourages decay and pests.

questions.q: The safest general time to prune most deciduous trees is:
questions.explain: Dormant pruning minimizes stress and reduces disease pressure.

questions.q: Why should dead or diseased branches be removed?
choices: They can spread pathogens and weaken structure
questions.explain: Removing compromised wood improves plant health and structural safety.

questions.q: Excessive fertilizer use can harm plants by:
choices: Burning roots and disrupting water uptake
questions.explain: High salt concentrations from fertilizer can damage roots and interfere with water absorption.

questions.q: Fertilizer labels use numbers like 10-10-10 to represent:
choices: Percentages of nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium
questions.explain: These numbers indicate nutrient percentages by weight.

questions.q: Chlorosis is most often characterized by:
questions.explain: Chlorosis commonly results from nutrient deficiencies affecting chlorophyll production.

questions.q: Which factor most strongly influences plant hardiness?
questions.explain: Cold tolerance is the basis of USDA hardiness zones.

questions.q: Integrated Pest Management (IPM) emphasizes:
choices: Monitoring and using the least disruptive controls first
questions.explain: IPM prioritizes observation and targeted, minimal intervention.

questions.q: Many plant diseases spread most easily under:
questions.explain: Extended leaf wetness promotes fungal and bacterial growth.

questions.q: Why is proper plant spacing important?
choices: It limits competition and disease pressure
questions.explain: Adequate spacing improves airflow and reduces stress and disease.

questions.q: Why should native plants often be favored in landscapes?
choices: They are adapted to local conditions
questions.explain: Native plants evolved with local soils, climate, and ecosystems.
